paper.title: Determining an initial image pair for fixing the scale of a 3d reconstruction from an image sequence

author.org: Institute for Photogrammetry, Bonn University, Germany#TAB#
Institute for Photogrammetry, Bonn University, Germany#TAB#

paper.abstract: Algorithms for metric 3d reconstruction of scenes from calibrated image sequences always require an initialization phase for fixing the scale of the reconstruction. Usually this is done by selecting two frames from the sequence and fixing the length of their base-line. In this paper a quality measure, that is based on the uncertainty of the reconstructed scene points, for the selection of such a stable image pair is proposed. Based on this quality measure a fully automatic initialization phase for simultaneous localization and mapping algorithms is derived. The proposed algorithm runs in real-time and some results for synthetic as well as real image sequences are shown.
